data.text: Any guesses what the “alternative arrangements” are in the Brady amendment?#WithdrawalAgreement

No doubt in my mind that today’s events in Westminster are designed to buy more time for the UK Govt. and not to create a secure future for the UK. The EU has already said it won’t renegotiate, as did the Prime Minister until now. Depressing. #WithdrawalAgreement
RT @DerynConsulting: Chairman of @Cardiff_Airport Roger Lewis & CEO @debbarber27 welcomes AMs to the launch of their annual update - kindly…
@SteveStacey4 None of which are acceptable to Ireland
@OwenJones84 It’s when they ignore you you have to worry Owen

The first problem with this is that it assumes that the EU would simply accept dropping the backstop without a murmur. The second is that it talks vaguely of “alternative arrangements”. If they actually existed they would have been agreed by now.  https://t.co/H2tnaYPwwT
@ruthjoneswales congratulations Ruth. Well done.
@huwthomas_Wales @Lisa_Eire @mattforde A deep slur on the good and generous people of that county, including yourself......
@RebeccaEvansAM So if there’s no deal it’ll be The fault of Airbus🤔

Envious of @Lisa_Eire and the kids with their dual nationality. An Irish passport means they can live and work in the EU AND UK.  I don’t qualify. I’ve tried to argue that a great grandfather from Aberaeron is close enough. Joking aside, this is the effect on families @mattforde

And so this morning other extreme Brexiteers fail to rule out closing down Parliament to prevent debate in a House of Commons that was elected after the referendum and is more reflective of people’s views. They didn’t vote for no deal.

All this talk of prorogation reminds me the the Northern Ireland Parliament was prorogued in 1972 after Bloody Sunday and armed conflict. Surely we’re not at that point? The best history of it is “How Stormont Fell” by Henry Kelly ( yes, he of Going for Gold fame)

BBC News - Rees-Mogg says reformed Brexit deal could win over critics https://t.co/fvBmrbD6MN.   Let me get this right. He wants to get the Queen to shut down Parliament to stop debate on Brexit. I thought he lived in the 19th century not the 17th.@mattforde
You’ve got to be joking. According to Brexiteers the UK has a great future outside the EU and now we have one of the most prominent advocates moving his HQ to Singapore!  https://t.co/zDG3R6DbGR
RT @DerynConsulting: @AMCarwyn has replaced @Amanwy on the Constitutional and Legislative Affairs Committee | Mae Carwyn Jones wedi cymrud…
RT @DerynConsulting: @MohammadAsghar replaces @siangwenfelin, @huw4ogmore replaces @JackSargeantAM, and @AMCarwyn replaces @JBryantWales on…

Absolutely right. Women have been vilified for coming forward and the media have not covered it in the way it deserves. Wales cannot be left behind. At the moment, we are.@WalesPolitics @WalesOnline @ITVWales https://t.co/GuY2c8dbue

March 29th looms and we are still no further forward. There has to be a series of indicative votes.We are close to a second referendum if this can’t be settled. Remainer or Leaver, there has to be a case for it to decide once and for all what people want. https://t.co/EG9nSfFhVR
Astonishing, but sadly not surprising.  https://t.co/64mLV2WXpS

RT @LeanneWood: Heddiw / today - 2pm, Pierhead Building, Cardiff Bay.
Help us build a @TIMESUPNOW network in Wales. https://t.co/Jg5UAtTaud
Looking forward to talking at the Institute for Government this morning. A look back on a career (so far!)
How much is a “small number of years”? https://t.co/liEY62n1r4
RT @mrjamesob: The Malign Incompetence of the British Ruling Class  https://t.co/i8OOe3HoBA

The Prime Minister wants to reach out to other parties now. Why on earth has it taken two years to do that? The clock is ticking are there are still no answers from Westminster.. Bad for Wales. Bad for Britain @WalesPolitics
RT @UniteWales: First Minister Mark Drakeford held discussions with @UniteWales Ford reps earlier this morning. Unite will do everything it…
This might have been better phrased https://t.co/e83y699Bk5

After a defeat by more than 200 votes in Parliament on an issue that the UK government supported more than any other I just can’t see how a General Election can be delayed. Time to let the public have a say on who governs them now.
RT @fmwales: Y bore 'ma cwrddais â gweithwyr, undebau a rheolwyr yn ffatri Ford ym Mhen-y-bont a phwysleisiais y byddwn yn gwneud popeth i…
RT @fmwales: Met with workers, unions and managers at Ford Bridgend this morning and told them we will do everything we can to protect jobs…

I asked the Minister if he will commit to monitoring the situation closely and to work with Ford Europe, with the management and unions at the Bridgend plant and also those who represent Bridgend to secure the future of the plant and of course its dedicated workforce https://t.co/3WkLN4wyMu

Had the opportunity earlier this afternoon via an urgent question to ask the Economy & Transport Minister Ken Skates about Ford Bridgend. I asked what assessment has the Minister made of the current situation in Ford Europe & its potential effect on the Bridgend Engine Plant https://t.co/mnPSphV9Qn
RT @WalesPolitics: "Its difficult to conceive that Steffan was a member of the assembly for such a short time, such great his contribution,…
RT @CllrJPB: Out campaigning for @AlanaDavies9 in Porthcawl for the upcoming by-election on the Town Council. https://t.co/VShXcWnuPa
@elisjames Hi Elis. Oes cynlluniau ‘da ti I wneud “stand-up” yn Gymraeg yn y dyfodol agos? Llawer  o bobol wedi gofyn I fi. Diolch
RT @fmwales: I would like to express my own deep and personal sorrow at the loss of Steffan Lewis AM, one of the most decent and able polit…

Very sad to hear this news. Admired across the parties,people listened when Steffan spoke. He would have served Wales well for decades. We all admired the courage he showed with his illness. All my thoughts are with Steffan’s family ⁦@Plaid_Cymru⁩  https://t.co/EcrFtzrJvR
@CiaranWhelan13 @BrooklynGaelic @BBCnireland I have. You have the same wife as my wife. I’m trying to be even handed!
@TeyrnasGwent @DrBenScreen @BBCnireland Being married to a Belfast Catholic who speaks Welsh and did Irish A level gives an unusual perspective!
A reminder of Belfast’s past and not I hope a sign of its future https://t.co/dN8Ipyhago

@TeyrnasGwent @DrBenScreen @BBCnireland True indeed. Unfortunately it became associated solely with nationalist politics in the 20th Century. There’s now an Irish Language Centre in East Belfast though

Sad that an Irish Language Act is still an obstacle to the return of the N. I.Assembly. We’ve had Language Acts in Wales since 1967. True that Irish is associated with one community but surely part of reconciliation is about recognising Irish and also Ulster Scots.@BBCnireland
@KateMaltby Because Brexiteers thought that Ireland would leave the EU at the same time, because as Irish history shows, people there are always eager to follow whatever they are told from London
RT @KateMaltby: There is one way in which #BrexitTheUncivilWar perfectly represented the 2016 referendum. At no point did a single characte…
Some geography lessons needed for some. The UK is not an island.  https://t.co/y6bayoExfg

Not representative of the vast majority of Brexit voters I know but did these idiots really think that a group of men abusing a woman would help their cause. What big brave boys they are. ⁦@Anna_Soubry⁩  https://t.co/EWPOdLNbrG
@StephenHavard Hi Stephen. If you give my office a call on 01656664320 they’ll be able to advise you

Been at the Bridgend civic amenity site where I spoke to a Ford worker worried about a no-deal Brexit. At which point another man came over demanding a no-deal Brexit. When I asked about Ford he said he didn’t care because he’d just landed a £25m contract. He’s alright Jack
RT @Llwynaumawr: Delighted that @AMCarwyn was our speaker at @StudyofParl conference. Engaging and frank. Appropriate swansong for me. Cong…
@StudyofParl delighted to have delivered last night’s Michael Wheeler-Booth lecture. Thanks for the invitation. Lots of issues covered by the questions afterwards.
Great to see this happen after nine years of lobbying to have it reopened. A promise made last year that’s been kept. Go raibh maith agat Eire https://t.co/4Qtns9sD0H
RT @CllrJPB: Great response on the doorstep tonight in Brackla for our candidate Johanna. Don’t forget to vote tomorrow. https://t.co/yP0iJ…

tweets.text: Chairman of @Cardiff_Airport Roger Lewis & CEO @debbarber27 welcomes AMs to the launch of their annual update - kindly sponsored by @RhunapIorwerth Great to hear that there’s been an 8% increase in passenger numbers in the last year - nearly 1.6m passengers ✈️ https://t.co/mCvEW0BZvL

Self-indulgent tweet, but honestly, the level of obsessiveness some people have towards me on this site is somewhere between pitiful and creepy. It can't be healthy. I'm really not that interesting. Think of all the life you're wasting here.
@AMCarwyn @Lisa_Eire @mattforde Presumably your Cardiganshire heritage made them worry you wouldn't pay the admin fee!
When, oh when, will Brexiteers start owning their mess instead of looking for others to blame? https://t.co/Rnasx97n9O

@AMCarwyn has replaced @Amanwy on the Constitutional and Legislative Affairs Committee | Mae Carwyn Jones wedi cymrud lle Lee Waters ar y Pwyllgor Materion Cyfansoddiadol @SeneddMCD https://t.co/hCR6DIScRO

“Sexual harassment & discrimination in the workplace have a very real impact on the ability of women to participate in the economy - tackling this is an economic imperative” - our CEO @cerysfurlong taking part in the #TimesUpWales network meeting organised by @LeanneWood https://t.co/pbD8amRBON

First Minister Mark Drakeford held discussions with @UniteWales Ford reps earlier this morning. Unite will do everything it can to ensure a viable future for the world class Bridgend site. #Ford #Bridgend https://t.co/Q17WNUBgPs

Y bore 'ma cwrddais â gweithwyr, undebau a rheolwyr yn ffatri Ford ym Mhen-y-bont a phwysleisiais y byddwn yn gwneud popeth i ddiogelu swyddi a sicrhau dyfodol tymor hir y ffatri. https://t.co/fSTbZ84BAe
Met with workers, unions and managers at Ford Bridgend this morning and told them we will do everything we can to protect jobs and secure a long term future for the plant. https://t.co/KaDmK2E7H0

"Its difficult to conceive that Steffan was a member of the assembly for such a short time, such great his contribution," said @AMCarwyn, former first minister.

"I for one found his contribution to the debate on Brexit to be invaluable." https://t.co/JLBabICTtd
Out campaigning for @AlanaDavies9 in Porthcawl for the upcoming by-election on the Town Council. https://t.co/VShXcWnuPa

I would like to express my own deep and personal sorrow at the loss of Steffan Lewis AM, one of the most decent and able politicians of his generation. 

My thoughts and sympathies are with his wife Shona & young son Celyn at this incredibly difficult time.

@AMCarwyn @BrooklynGaelic @BBCnireland The Irish language is ancient and part of everyone’s history on this island. To equate Ulster Scots with it is just wrong. It is a dialect of English. Have you ever heard it or read it? I bet u understood 90% of it

@AMCarwyn @DrBenScreen @BBCnireland Thanks for acknowledging that. And yes, East Belfast is a superb example of progress. If folks had a greater knowledge of their own history, maybe attitudes towards an Irish Language Act from many of those who oppose it, would not be so resolute. It’s part of their history too.
@BBCRadio4 #CollectingTheTroubles @UlsterMuseum One for the archive: a gift my mother was given by one of her primary school pupils in the late ‘70s after a street gun battle. https://t.co/YFYF47Pqg6

@AMCarwyn @DrBenScreen @BBCnireland Incorrect Carwyn. Gaelige belongs to everyone, and does not have to be ‘associated with one side of the community.’ In 19th century Ireland, Presbyterians actually did more to promote Irish than the Catholic Church. The latter used Latin until the 1960s. https://t.co/IIvcshqS63
There is one way in which #BrexitTheUncivilWar perfectly represented the 2016 referendum. At no point did a single character think to mention the Irish border.

@AMCarwyn Could you look into the street lighting around the Bridgend Industrial Estate, especially between the CGI site at Hughes Park and their overflow car park. Very dangerous walking in the dark there as no street lighting on and I have to often use my phone torch. Thanks

Delighted that @AMCarwyn was our speaker at @StudyofParl conference. Engaging and frank. Appropriate swansong for me. Congratulations to @LordNortonLouth, my successor in the not-too-onerous job of president of a great group
Great response on the doorstep tonight in Brackla for our candidate Johanna. Don’t forget to vote tomorrow. https://t.co/yP0iJ1T2ac
